title: Strictly hunk and ex Emmerdale star Kelvin Fletcher offered West End Joseph role

Strictly beefcake Kelvin Fletcher has been offered the lead role in West End smash Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.

The former Emmerdale actor, 35, has wowed fans of the BBC contest after being drafted in as a replacement for crocked Made in Chelsea star Jamie Laing.

And the bookies’ favourite – last night 6/4 to triumph – is already being offered a £250,000 post-glitterball gig in the stage classic.

A source said: “Producers are keen to snap up Kelvin for a lead in the musical and have approached him with a £250,000 offer this week.

“He has agreed to meet the producers at the top of the new year, once the Strictly madness is over. They are aware of his popularity and excellent dancing skills and they have also been made aware he has a fairly good voice too.

“They are confident that with a few singing lessons he would be a perfect fit for a starring role. They know he will be in huge demand after Strictly, so wanted to get in early.”

(Image: BBC)

Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat had a sell-out season this summer and will return to London’s Palladium for a six-week run next summer.

Previous Josephs include Phillip Schofield and Jason Donovan – who returned in this year’s run as Pharaoh.

Strictly judges Bruno Tonioli and Shirley Ballas gave Kelvin and pro dance partner Oti Mabuse the first two tens of the series last week – which put them top of the scoreboard with 38 out of a possible 40.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: PA)

Now Kelvin is the favourite for a win that could reinvigorate his career.

He played Emmerdale farmer Andy Sugden, joining the ITV soap in 1996 and leaving after 20 years to focus on stock car racing.

But he has never had the opportunity to show off the skills he learned at stage school in his native Oldham.

The source added: “Right now, Kelvin is focused on Strictly but he’s very excited about what will come next.”
description: EXCLUSIVE: He's wowed fans of BBC's Strictly Come Dancing and now Kelvin Fletcher could star in stage classic Joseph and the Technicolour Dreamcoat
